verses.text: Now it came to pass upon a day, that Jonathan the son of Saul said unto the young man that bare his armour, Come, and let us go over to the Philistines’ garrison, that \add is\add* on the other side. But he told not his father.
And Saul tarried in the uttermost part of Gibeah under a pomegranate tree which \add is\add* in Migron: and the people that \add were\add* with him \add were\add* about six hundred men;
and Ahiah, the son of Ahitub, Ichabod’s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the \sc Lord’s\sc* priest in Shiloh, wearing an ephod. And the people knew not that Jonathan was gone.

And between the passages, \add by\add* which Jonathan sought to go over unto the Philistines’ garrison, \add there was\add* a sharp rock on the one side, and a sharp rock on the other side: and the name of the one \add was\add* Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
The forefront of the one \add was\add* situate northward over against Michmash, and the other southward over against Gibeah.

And Jonathan said to the young man that bare his armour, Come, and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that the \sc Lord\sc* will work for us: for \add there is\add* no restraint to the \sc Lord\sc* to save by many or by few.
And his armourbearer said unto him, Do all that \add is\add* in thine heart: turn thee; behold, I \add am\add* with thee according to thy heart.
Then said Jonathan, Behold, we will pass over unto \add these\add* men, and we will discover ourselves unto them.
If they say thus unto us, Tarry until we come to you; then we will stand still in our place, and will not go up unto them.
But if they say thus, Come up unto us; then we will go up: for the \sc Lord\sc* hath delivered them into our hand: and this \add shall be\add* a sign unto us.
And both of them discovered themselves unto the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, Behold, the Hebrews come forth out of the holes where they had hid themselves.

And the men of the garrison answered Jonathan and his armourbearer, and said, Come up to us, and we will shew you a thing. And Jonathan said unto his armourbearer, Come up after me: for the \sc Lord\sc* hath delivered them into the hand of Israel.
And Jonathan climbed up upon his hands and upon his feet, and his armourbearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armourbearer slew after him.
And \add that\add* first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armourbearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were a half acre of land, \add which\add* a yoke \add of oxen might plow\add*.
And there was trembling in the host, in the field, and among all the people: the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled, and the earth quaked: so it was a very great trembling.
And the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked; and behold, the multitude melted away, and they went on beating down \add one another\add*.

Then said Saul unto the people that \add were\add* with him, Number now, and see who is gone from us. And when they had numbered, behold, Jonathan and his armourbearer \add were\add* not \add there\add*.
And Saul said unto Ahiah, Bring hither the ark of God. For the ark of God was at that time with the children of Israel.
And it came to pass, while Saul talked unto the priest, that the noise that \add was\add* in the host of the Philistines went on and increased: and Saul said unto the priest, Withdraw thine hand.

And Saul and all the people that \add were\add* with him assembled themselves, and they came to the battle: and behold, every man’s sword was against his fellow, \add and there was\add* a very great discomfiture.

Moreover the Hebrews \add that\add* were with the Philistines before that time, which went up with them into the camp \add from the country\add* round about, even they also \add turned\add* to be with the Israelites that \add were\add* with Saul and Jonathan.
Likewise all the men of Israel which had hid themselves in mount Ephraim, \add when\add* they heard that the Philistines fled, even they also followed hard after them in the battle.
So the \sc Lord\sc* saved Israel that day: and the battle passed over \add unto\add* Beth-aven.

And the men of Israel were distressed that day: for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed \add be\add* the man that eateth \add any\add* food until evening, that I may be avenged on mine enemies. So none of the people tasted \add any\add* food.
And all \add they of\add* the land came to a wood; and there was honey upon the ground.
And when the people were come into the wood, behold, the honey dropped; but no man put his hand to his mouth: for the people feared the oath.

But Jonathan heard not when his father charged the people with the oath: wherefore he put forth the end of the rod that \add was\add* in his hand, and dipt it in a honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his eyes were enlightened.

Then answered one of the people, and said, Thy father straitly charged the people with an oath, saying, Cursed \add be\add* the man that eateth \add any\add* food \add this\add* day. And the people were faint.
Then said Jonathan, My father hath troubled the land: see, I pray you, how mine eyes have been enlightened, because I tasted a little of this honey.
How much more, if haply the people had eaten freely to day of the spoil of their enemies which they found? for had there not been now a much greater slaughter among the Philistines?
And they smote the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon: and the people were very faint.
And the people flew upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen, and calves, and slew \add them\add* on the ground: and the people did eat \add them\add* with the blood.
Then they told Saul, saying, Behold, the people sin against the \sc Lord\sc*, in that they eat with the blood. And he said, Ye have transgressed: roll a great stone unto me \add this\add* day.

And Saul said, Disperse yourselves among the people, and say unto them, Bring me hither every man his ox, and every man his sheep, and slay \add them\add* here, and eat; and sin not against the \sc Lord\sc* in eating with the blood. And all the people brought every man his ox with him \add that\add* night, and slew \add them\add* there.
And Saul built an altar unto the \sc Lord\sc*: the same was the first altar that he built unto the \sc Lord\sc*.

And Saul said, Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and spoil them until the morning light, and let us not leave a man of them. And they said, Do whatsoever seemeth good unto thee. Then said the priest, Let us draw near hither unto God.
And Saul asked \add counsel\add* of God, Shall I go down after the Philistines? wilt thou deliver them into the hand of Israel? But he answered him not that day.
And Saul said, Draw ye near hither, all the chief of the people: and know and see wherein this sin hath been \add this\add* day.

For, \add as\add* the \sc Lord\sc* liveth, which saveth Israel, though it be in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die. But \add there was\add* not \add a man\add* among all the people \add that\add* answered him.
Then said he unto all Israel, Be ye on one side, and I and Jonathan my son will be on the other side. And the people said unto Saul, Do what seemeth good unto thee.
Therefore Saul said unto the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, Give a perfect \add lot\add*. And Saul and Jonathan were taken: but the people escaped.
And Saul said, Cast \add lots\add* between me and Jonathan my son. And Jonathan was taken.

Then Saul said to Jonathan, Tell me what thou hast done. And Jonathan told him, and said, I did but taste a little honey with the end of the rod that \add was\add* in mine hand, \add and\add* lo, I must die.
And Saul answered, God do so and more also: for thou shalt surely die, Jonathan.

And the people said unto Saul, Shall Jonathan die, who hath wrought this great salvation in Israel? God forbid: \add as\add* the \sc Lord\sc* liveth, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he hath wrought with God this day. So the people rescued Jonathan, that he died not.
Then Saul went up from following the Philistines: and the Philistines went to their own place.

So Saul took the kingdom over Israel, and fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, and against the children of Ammon, and against Edom, and against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines: and whithersoever he turned himself, he vexed \add them\add*.
And he gathered a host, and smote the Amalekites, and delivered Israel out of the hands of them that spoiled them.
Now the sons of Saul were Jonathan, and Ishui, and Melchishua: and the names of his two daughters \add were these;\add* the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal:
and the name of Saul’s wife \add was\add* Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host \add was\add* Abner, the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.
And Kish \add was\add* the father of Saul; and Ner the father of Abner \add was\add* the son of Abiel.
And there was sore war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any strong man, or any valiant man, he took him unto him.
